page.title: 19FARMING 1
page.content:
{FARMING
The west and south western edges of this area are farmland. No one farm is entirely within the area, but there are large parts of Claxton Grange and Owton Grange farms. The local farms are of average size for this country, around{250}hectares. They are mixed farms, like most in Northern England. The landscape of the farmland is fairly flat, at about{30 metres above sea level. It is the local climate, with its short growing season and lower summer temperatures that leads farmers to keep a range of crops and animals. The main crops are Barley, Oil Seed Rape, Wheat and Potatoes. A large part of most farms is given to grazing land, while hay is grown as winter feed.
